study_goal: The researchers reviewed the role of the ATX-LPA signaling axis in cancer therapy, focusing on how LPA is generated from lysophosphatidylcholine (which contains choline) by ATX.
results_summary: The study highlights that LPA, derived from lysophosphatidylcholine via ATX, plays a significant role in cancer cell regulation, making the ATX-LPA axis a potential therapeutic target. Choline itself is not directly evaluated for efficacy or safety in this context.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether low-dose lithium could counteract microstructural and metabolic brain changes, including choline-containing compounds, in individuals at ultra-high risk for psychosis.
results_summary: Choline-containing compounds increased in the group receiving low-dose lithium but decreased or remained unchanged in the treatment-as-usual group, though the change was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Individuals at ultra-high risk (UHR) for psychosis
effective_dosage: Not specified for choline (study focused on low-dose lithium)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of 18F-NaF and 18F-FDG in diagnosing bone metastases, with brief mention of 18F-choline's potential role.
results_summary: The abstract mentions 18F-choline as one of the radiopharmaceuticals with affinity to bone lesions, but no specific results about its efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with bone metastases or bone lesions (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of oily fish (including Norwegian salmon, herring, and pompano) on cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk markers in Chinese women with hypertriacylglycerolaemia.
results_summary: The study found that consuming oily fish increased n-3 LC-PUFA intake, improved plasma lipid profiles, and reduced serum TAG, apoB, apoCII, and apoCIII levels. Salmon and herring also lowered TNF-α and raised adiponectin, with salmon additionally reducing IL-6.
population_specificity: 126 Chinese women aged 35-70 with hypertriacylglycerolaemia.
effective_dosage: 80 g fillets of oily fish or mixed meats, 5 days/week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intranasal bFGF nasal spray could enhance brain uptake of bFGF and improve memory impairment in a rat model of Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The study found that intranasal bFGF nasal spray significantly increased brain uptake of bFGF, particularly in the cerebrum and hippocampus, and improved spatial memory impairment in rats. It also restored enzyme activity and reduced neuronal degeneration, suggesting neuroprotective effects.
population_specificity: Rats with induced memory impairment via co-injection of β-amyloid(25-35) and ibotenic acid into the hippocampus.
effective_dosage: 20 μg/kg and 40 μg/kg of bFGF solution, administered intranasally or intravenously.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare motion compensation methodologies (prospective gating and offline correction) for improving the accuracy of measuring choline-containing metabolites (tCho) in abdominal tumors using magnetic resonance spectroscopy.
results_summary: Both motion compensation methods reduced tCho linewidth by 12-22%, with offline correction also significantly increasing SNR. The repeatability of tCho/water measurements improved by 37% (prospective gating) and 41% (offline correction), enhancing reproducibility.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers and cancer patients with abdominal tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in the synthesis of [(11)C]choline and other radiopharmaceuticals to enhance their clinical availability and use in oncology.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that [(11)C]choline, [(11)C]methionine, and [(11)C]acetate are valuable in oncology where [(18)F]FDG is suboptimal, but their production lacks standardization compared to [(18)F]FDG. The review focuses on improving synthesis methods to increase clinical use.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on oncology applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of FDG-PET scanning in staging and response assessment for upper gastrointestinal malignancies, with a brief mention of (11)C-choline as a novel radiotracer.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Choline's effects, focusing instead on FDG-PET's efficacy in malignancy management and mentioning (11)C-choline only as a potential alternative radiotracer.
population_specificity: Patients with malignancies of the upper gastrointestinal tract (gastric, esophageal, and pancreas carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical utility of (11)C-choline PET in optimizing target volume delineation and treatment regimens for postoperative radiotherapy in brain glioma patients.
results_summary: The study found that (11)C-choline PET provided better contrast and boundary definition between tumors and normal brain tissues compared to MRI, leading to changes in treatment regimens for 31.3% of patients. It also identified residual tumors in some cases where MRI was negative, suggesting its supplementary diagnostic value.
population_specificity: Sixteen postoperative brain glioma patients (WHO Grades II-IV).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether F-18 choline (CHO) PET could detect increased metabolism in FET-negative low-grade glioma (LGG) patients.
results_summary: The study found that CHO PET did not show increased uptake ratios in five out of six FET-negative LGG patients, with only one patient showing slightly increased uptake (1.24), which was not associated with tumor visualization. The authors concluded that CHO PET is not superior to FET PET for clinical purposes in this context.
population_specificity: Six patients with nongadolinium-enhancing, FET-negative low-grade gliomas (LGG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore metabolic variations, including choline (Cho) ratios, in brain regions implicated in pediatric OCD pathophysiology.
results_summary: The study found lower Cho ratios in the right and left anterior cingulate cortex and a higher Cho ratio in the left lenticular nucleus in pediatric OCD patients compared to controls.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 8-16 years with OCD (n=15) and matched healthy controls (n=15).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify disease proteins, including choline acetyltransferase (ChAT), involved in congenital myasthenic syndromes (CMS) and explore their roles in neuromuscular transmission.
results_summary: The study identified multiple disease proteins, including ChAT, associated with CMS and highlighted the need for improved therapy, though the molecular basis of some CMS remains unknown.
population_specificity: Individuals with congenital myasthenic syndromes (CMS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate metabolic changes in the temporal lobes, including choline (Cho) ratios, following radiation therapy for nasopharyngeal carcinoma using imaging techniques.
results_summary: The study found significantly lower NAA/Cho ratios in all patient groups compared to controls, with the greatest decrease in the group assessed less than 6 months post-radiotherapy. No significant differences were observed in Cho/Cr ratios between groups.
population_specificity: 48 patients post-radiotherapy for nasopharyngeal carcinoma and 24 healthy, age-matched controls.
study_duration: Groups were assessed at varying time intervals post-radiotherapy: <6 months, 6-12 months, and >12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential therapeutic effects of α7 nAChR agonists, including choline, on psychopathology domains like attention, cognition, and memory in individuals with autism spectrum disorders (ASDs).
results_summary: The study suggests that targeting the α7 nAChR with agonists like choline could be a viable therapeutic strategy for improving attention, cognition, and memory in individuals with ASDs, based on genetic and pharmacological rationale. However, specific clinical trial results are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Individuals with autism spectrum disorders (ASDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of abnormal choline metabolism in oncogenesis and tumor progression, and its potential as a non-invasive biomarker and therapeutic target.
results_summary: The study found that abnormal choline metabolism is associated with oncogenesis and tumor progression, with increased levels of choline-containing compounds serving as non-invasive biomarkers for transformation, staging, and therapy response. Enzymes like choline kinase were identified as novel targets for image-guided cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on oncogenesis and tumor progression)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a method for maximizing tumor control probability (TCP) using functional imaging and heterogeneous dose prescriptions in prostate cancer treatment with (18)F-choline PET imaging.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that a heterogeneous dose distribution based on radiobiological parameters could achieve a TCP of 94.7%, though optimization reduced this to 73.5%. Film verification confirmed reasonable agreement between planned and delivered doses.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients with (18)F-choline PET imaging.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose range: 87.1Gy to 99.3Gy for one parameter set).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of HCV clearance on cerebral metabolism, including choline levels, and neuropsychological performance.
results_summary: Significant reductions in basal ganglia Cho/Cr were observed in sustained virological responders, suggesting reduced cerebral infection or immune activation. Improvements in verbal learning, memory, and visuo-spatial memory were also noted in these responders.
population_specificity: Non-cirrhotic HCV-positive subjects
study_duration: Not specified (measured before, during, and after treatment)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify mutations in proteins related to congenital myasthenic syndromes (CMS), including choline acetyltransferase, and analyze their molecular consequences to improve therapy.
results_summary: The study identified disease proteins involved in CMS, such as choline acetyltransferase, and analyzed their electrophysiologic and biochemical properties to understand mutation effects and enhance treatment.
population_specificity: Individuals with congenital myasthenic syndromes (CMS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if changes in choline levels measured via MRS before, during, and after radiotherapy could predict survival outcomes in high-grade glioma patients.
results_summary: The study found that a >40% decrease in normalized choline from week 4 of RT to 2 months post-RT was associated with significantly worse overall survival and progression-free survival, indicating choline changes as a prognostic marker.
population_specificity: 26 patients with high-grade glioma undergoing surgery and radiotherapy.
study_duration: MRS measurements were taken before RT, at week 4 of RT, and 2 months post-RT.

study_goal: To determine the reproducibility of 3D proton magnetic resonance spectroscopic imaging (1H-MRSI) for assessing choline plus creatine to citrate ratio (CC/C) in the human prostate at 1.5T.
results_summary: The study found high reproducibility of 3D 1H-MRSI measurements, with a within-voxel standard deviation of 0.13 for CC/C ratios, comparable to between-subject variability in noncancer prostate tissue. Over 90% of voxels showed consistent clinical scores between repeated measurements.
population_specificity: Fourteen subjects with prostate measurements using an endorectal coil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic accuracy of [(11)C]choline PET/CT versus bone scintigraphy (BS) in detecting bone metastases in prostate cancer patients with biochemical progression.
results_summary: [(11)C]choline PET/CT showed high specificity (98-100%) and accuracy (95-96%) but lower sensitivity (89%) compared to BS, which had higher sensitivity (100-70%) but lower specificity (75-100%). Equivocal findings were more frequent in BS (27%) than in [(11)C]choline PET/CT (1%).
population_specificity: 78 patients with biochemical progression of prostate cancer (mean PSA 21.1 ng/ml).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize genetic, molecular, and functional information on human neutrophil alloantigens (HNAs), particularly focusing on HNA-3's localization on choline transporter-like protein 2 (CTL2) and its implications in immune-related diseases.
results_summary: The study found that HNA-3 is localized on CTL2 and involves an Arg154Gln substitution, with the HNA-3a epitope being conformation-sensitive. Additionally, CD177 (HNA-2) interacts with PECAM-1, mediating neutrophil evasion, and its expression is influenced by SNPs.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on neutrophil antigens and immune-related conditions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of [(18)F]fluoromethyl-dimethyl-2-hydroxyethyl-ammonium ((18)F-FCH) as a PET/CT imaging agent for prostate cancer by reviewing existing studies on its radiosynthesis, preclinical and clinical dosimetry, biodistribution, and diagnostic performance.
results_summary: The review of 37 studies involving 1244 patients found that (18)F-FCH shows promise for imaging prostate cancer, including local disease, nodal disease, bone metastases, and biochemical recurrence, though variations in study design and techniques affected reported performance.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer (local disease, nodal disease, bone metastases, castrate-resistant disease, and biochemical recurrence).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of normalized versus non-normalized metabolite ratios, including choline (Cho), in differentiating recurrent brain tumors from radiation injury using magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
results_summary: Non-normalized ratios Cho/NAA and NAA/Cr showed strong discriminatory ability for tumor recurrence (sensitivity 86-93%, specificity 70-90%), outperforming normalized ratios. Cho/nNAA was the only normalized ratio with some correlation but lost significance after multiple comparisons.
population_specificity: 25 patients with a history of primary intracranial neoplasm treated with radiation therapy (54-70 Gy) and new contrast-enhancing lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of radiolabeled choline (11C-choline and 18F-FEC) in prostate cancer xenograft mouse models and assess its utility for tumor delineation and therapy response monitoring.
results_summary: The study found that 11C-choline and 18F-FEC showed insufficient uptake in both hormone-independent and hormone-dependent prostate tumor models, with no significant tumor-to-muscle ratio. Radiolabeled choline derivatives were less effective compared to other tracers like 18F-FLT and 18F-FDG for tumor delineation and therapy response monitoring.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer xenograft mouse models (PC-3, DU145, CWR22, PAC120).
study_duration: PET imaging performed over 4 consecutive days; post-castration imaging timing not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of molecular imaging using Choline PET/CT in radiation treatment planning for prostate cancer, particularly for dose escalation in tumor recurrence.
results_summary: The study found that Choline PET/CT is effective in identifying tumor recurrence locations, enabling targeted dose escalation without increasing toxicity. The hybrid PET/CT technology improves image fusion accuracy, supporting the simultaneous boost concept in radiotherapy.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients, particularly those with local recurrence after primary radiation treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical activity of ATN-224 (choline tetrathiomolybdate) in patients with biochemically recurrent hormone-naïve prostate cancer, testing its potential antiangiogenic and direct antitumor effects at two dose levels.
results_summary: Low-dose ATN-224 (30 mg daily) showed biologic activity with improved PSA kinetics, but no dose-response effect was observed, and the clinical significance of PSA changes remains uncertain. The study did not demonstrate clear superiority of either dose, and further development of ATN-224 for prostate cancer was discontinued.
population_specificity: Men with biochemically recurrent prostate cancer (PSA doubling time <12 months, no metastasis, no recent hormonal therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of choline-containing compounds (tCho) as a metabolic marker for diagnosing and monitoring therapeutic response in breast cancer using in vivo MRS.
results_summary: Malignant breast tissues showed elevated tCho levels, which significantly decreased in responders during therapy. However, MRS faced challenges in sensitivity and technical limitations for detecting tCho in smaller or nonfocal lesions.
population_specificity: Women with breast diseases, particularly those with ductal-type neoplasms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if (1)H-MRSI could detect metabolic changes, including choline levels, in noninfarcted patients with ICA/MCA stenosis or occlusion compared to infarcted patients and healthy controls.
results_summary: The study found increased choline levels in the ischemic hemisphere of noninfarcted patients compared to the contralateral side and healthy controls, suggesting metabolic disruption. These changes were associated with neurological status but were less pronounced than in infarcted patients.
population_specificity: 50 noninfarcted patients with unilateral ICA/MCA stenosis or occlusion, 25 cerebral infarction patients, and 25 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine sex differences in brain biochemical concentrations, including choline, and their association with plasma homocysteine levels in healthy elderly subjects.
results_summary: Female participants had significantly higher choline levels in the left frontal lobe and hippocampus compared to males. The study did not directly assess choline's efficacy but noted its variation by sex.
population_specificity: Healthy elderly subjects without psychiatric or neurological diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review radio-compounds, including F-18 choline, for detecting and characterizing bone metastases, distinguishing between osteotropic and oncotropic agents.
results_summary: The abstract mentions F-18 choline as a non-specific oncotropic agent used for detecting metastatic tumor cells, but detailed results on its efficacy are not provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of bone metastasis detection).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of C-11 choline (CHO) and C-11 methionine (MET) in PET imaging for detecting brain metastases, correlating findings with histopathology results.
results_summary: CHO demonstrated significantly higher lesion-to-normal brain tissue ratios (LNRs) compared to MET, suggesting better imaging potential for brain metastases without evidence of lower specificity. Biopsy confirmed viable metastases in most patients, with CHO showing superior LNRs in tumor tissue.
population_specificity: 8 patients with brain metastases, 7 of whom had prior radiation therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate novel imaging techniques, including choline-based PET/CT, for detecting metastases in genitourinary malignancies.
results_summary: The study discusses the use of (11)C-choline and (18)F-choline PET/CT as part of advanced imaging techniques for detecting lymph node metastases in prostate, bladder, penile, and testicular cancers, highlighting their potential diagnostic utility.
population_specificity: Patients with genitourinary malignancies (prostate, bladder, penile, and testicular cancers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of choline concentration as an early indicator of treatment response in breast cancer using MRI and MRS techniques.
results_summary: The study found that choline concentration, along with T(2) value and water-to-fat ratio, serves as a response indicator in breast cancer treatment. Functional imaging techniques like MRS allowed tracking of metabolic changes, aiding in early assessment of treatment efficacy.
population_specificity: High-risk women and breast cancer patients undergoing neoadjuvant treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding growth hormone (GH) to riluzole, with doses adjusted based on IGF-I production, could reduce neuronal loss, mortality, and improve motor function in ALS patients, as measured by the NAA/(Cre + Cho) ratio.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of GH on cerebral NAA levels or clinical progression (ALSFRS-R). The NAA/(Cre + Cho) ratio decreased in all patients, with no difference between GH-treated and placebo groups.
population_specificity: Patients with definite/probable ALS, aged 40-85, on riluzole, with disease duration ≤3 years.
effective_dosage: Initial dose of 2 IU GH subcutaneously every other day, increased to a maximum of 8 IU.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic capabilities of 11C-choline versus 18F-FDG in detecting metastatic bladder cancer using PET/CT imaging.
results_summary: 11C-choline PET/CT showed a lower positive predictive value (84.7%) compared to 18F-FDG (90.7%) for detecting lesions, with 18F-FDG correctly identifying more extravesical metastases. The study concluded that 11C-choline offered no advantage over 18F-FDG in detecting metastatic bladder cancer.
population_specificity: 20 consecutive patients with bladder cancer undergoing evaluation for local and metastatic disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize observations on PBN-nitrones, including OKN-007, in experimental cancer models and discuss their potential mechanisms as anti-cancer agents.
results_summary: The study found that PBN-nitrones, particularly OKN-007, showed potent anti-cancer activity in rat glioma models and were safe for human use, though efficacy for stroke was previously disproven. Possible mechanisms include suppression of NO production and inhibition of NF-κB activation.
population_specificity: Experimental cancer models (rat choline deficiency liver cancer, rat C6 glioma, mouse APC(Min/+) colon cancer).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of choline-based tracers in PET imaging for tumor diagnosis, staging, and therapy monitoring.
results_summary: The study highlights that choline-based tracers, along with other molecules, enable quantitative assessment of transport and metabolization changes in tumors, aiding therapy monitoring. It also suggests non-invasive apoptosis assessment could serve as a surrogate marker for therapeutic efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general reference to preclinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of imaging techniques, including PET/CT using 11C-choline, 18F-fluorocholine, or 11C-acetate, in detecting local recurrences and distant metastases of prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that functional and molecular imaging techniques like PET/CT using choline derivatives (11C-choline, 18F-fluorocholine) were successful in detecting prostate cancer recurrences and metastases, outperforming conventional imaging methods. However, in controversial cases, biopsies under MRI or TRUS guidance were still necessary.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer post-definitive treatment (e.g., radiotherapy, HIFU, cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic, prognostic, and therapeutic potential of choline as a biomarker in acute coronary syndrome (ACS) and percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
results_summary: The abstract mentions choline as a promising future biomarker for ACS and PCI but does not provide specific results regarding its effects. The review discusses its potential clinical application alongside other biomarkers.
population_specificity: Patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS) and those undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of acetylcholine (ACh) on human bronchial epithelial cells and how cigarette smoke extract (CSE) modifies the cellular response to ACh, affecting the non-neuronal cholinergic system signaling.
results_summary: ACh induced concentration-dependent LTB(4) release via ERK1/2 and NFkB pathways in 16-HBE cells, which was down-regulated by muscarinic receptor antagonists and pathway inhibitors. CSE treatment increased ACh binding, shifted LTB4 release sensitivity, and upregulated ChAT, M(2), M(3), and endogenous ACh production, with Tiotropium mitigating some effects.
population_specificity: Human bronchial epithelial cells (16-HBE)
interactions: Tiotropium, Gallamine, Telenzepine, 4-DAMP, PD 098059, BAY117082 (inhibitors/antagonists used in the study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the automated synthesis of [C]CH3Br as an analog for [C]CH3I and its use in producing C-labeled tracers, including [N-methyl-C]choline, for PET imaging.
results_summary: The study demonstrated successful synthesis of [N-methyl-C]choline with a radiochemical yield of 60.3±1.8% and purity >95%, and effective PET imaging in patients with brain cancer and Parkinson's disease.
population_specificity: Patients with brain cancer and Parkinson's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of stereotactic body radiotherapy for treating limited nodal recurrences of prostate cancer detected via choline PET imaging.
results_summary: Choline PET detected recurrences in 39 of 71 patients, with higher PSA velocity in PET-positive subjects. Stereotactic body radiotherapy showed persistent regression in 13 of 25 treated patients, with 3-year overall survival and local control rates of 92% and 90%, respectively.
population_specificity: 71 patients with recurrent prostate cancer post-prostatectomy, radiotherapy, or both.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the utility of Choline-PET/CT in selecting and delineating clinical target volumes for radiotherapy in primary and recurrent prostate cancer, and to assess its potential for dose escalation while minimizing irradiation of healthy tissues.
results_summary: Choline-PET/CT showed promising results in targeting prostate cancer and lymph nodal sites, with high overall survival (94%) and biochemical relapse-free survival (83% for primary, 49% for recurrent cancer). Acute toxicity was mild in most patients, and late side effects were minimal.
population_specificity: 26 patients with primary (n=7) or recurrent (n=19) prostate cancer, median age 65 years.
effective_dosage: Median dose to primary tumors was 75.6 Gy and to FEC-positive recurrent lymph nodal sites 66.6 Gy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical feasibility of using 3D proton MRS to detect choline as a marker of malignancy in ovarian masses.
results_summary: A choline peak was detected in 89% of malignant ovarian tumors, demonstrating high sensitivity, but it was also present in 3 out of 4 benign tumors, reducing specificity. The study found a significant difference in choline peak integrals between solid and cystic tumor components.
population_specificity: 16 patients with 23 ovarian masses (19 malignant, 4 benign).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate changes in choline (Cho) levels in recurrent glioblastoma multiforme (rGBM) patients to characterize the metabolic response to antiangiogenic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that Cho/norCre ratios in enhancing tumor tissue decreased after day 28 of treatment, suggesting a metabolic effect of cediranib. NAA/Cho ratios in tumor tissue showed predictive value for 6-month overall survival.
population_specificity: 31 patients with recurrent glioblastoma multiforme (rGBM)
effective_dosage: Daily doses of cediranib (specific dosage not mentioned)
study_duration: Serial measurements taken during treatment, with notable changes observed after day 28 and day 56

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate the performance of MR spectroscopic imaging (MRSI) at 3 T for assessing prostate cancer aggressiveness using choline-related metabolite ratios (Cho+Cr/Cit and Cho/Cr).
results_summary: The study found that maximum Cho+Cr/Cit and Cho/Cr ratios, along with a malignancy rating, effectively differentiated low-grade from higher-grade prostate tumors, with ROC curve areas of 0.70, 0.74, and 0.78, respectively. MRSI showed promise for noninvasive assessment of tumor aggressiveness.
population_specificity: 43 biopsy-proven prostate cancer patients with 53 clinically relevant tumor foci.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the evidence on the usefulness of cholinesterase inhibitors (including choline-related mechanisms) for the treatment and prevention of delirium.
results_summary: The data on cholinesterase inhibitors for delirium treatment and prevention are accumulating but do not appear convincing, suggesting limited efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with delirium (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of choline PET/CT in restaging prostate cancer patients with biochemical relapse and to understand the relationship between PSA kinetics and choline PET/CT detection rates.
results_summary: The study found that choline PET/CT is primarily useful for detecting local, lymph node-related, or distant recurrence in prostate cancer patients with biochemical relapse, with PSA values playing a significant role in patient selection for this diagnostic procedure.
population_specificity: Patients with treated prostate cancer who developed biochemical relapse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective role of VEGF, particularly its effect on choline acetyltransferase (ChAT) expression, in NSC-34 cells exposed to cerebrospinal fluid from sporadic ALS patients.
results_summary: VEGF reduced LDH activity and restored ChAT expression in NSC-34 cells exposed to ALS-CSF, indicating a neuroprotective effect against degenerative changes induced by ALS-CSF.
population_specificity: NSC-34 cell line exposed to cerebrospinal fluid from sporadic ALS patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether citicoline affects the sleep/wake cycles of cocaine-dependent individuals as part of assessing its efficacy for treating cocaine dependence.
results_summary: Citicoline had no effect on any measured sleep parameters in cocaine-dependent participants, suggesting it does not disturb sleep/wake cycles. The study found no improvement in sleep efficiency, latency, total sleep time, or other sleep-related metrics.
population_specificity: Cocaine-dependent, polydrug-using individuals who were non-abstinent.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of PET and PET/CT using [(11)C]- and [(18)F]-labeled choline derivatives for imaging prostate cancer, particularly in cases of biochemical recurrence.
results_summary: The study found that choline PET/CT improves lesion localization and characterization, with a detection rate of about 75% in patients with PSA > 3 ng/ml. It is useful for diagnosing recurrence and guiding individualized treatment strategies, though differentiation between benign conditions and cancer remains challenging.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer, particularly those with biochemical recurrence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of choline phospholipid metabolism in cancer cells and its potential as a pharmacodynamic biomarker for targeted therapies.
results_summary: The study found that aberrant choline metabolism is a hallmark of cancer cells and can be detected via MRS, with potential implications for monitoring treatment response and identifying novel therapeutic targets.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro or preclinical models, not specified for human subjects).

study_goal: To evaluate the role of PET/CT imaging, particularly with choline, in diagnosing and restaging prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Choline PET/CT is clinically useful for restaging prostate cancer patients with rising prostate-specific antigen levels post-treatment but is not recommended for initial diagnosis or staging due to limitations in assessing intraprostatic tumors and small lymph node involvement.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients, particularly those with rising prostate-specific antigen levels after radical treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify biomarkers of disease severity in multiple system atrophy of cerebellar type by analyzing metabolite concentrations, including choline compounds, in the brainstem.
results_summary: The study found that total choline compounds concentrations in the pons and medulla were significantly lower in multiple system atrophy of cerebellar type patients compared to control subjects, suggesting a potential role as a biomarker for neuronal cell loss.
population_specificity: 12 multiple system atrophy of cerebellar type patients and 12 age- and gender-matched control subjects.

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the use of choline as a positron emission tomography tracer for identifying tumor burden in dose painting strategies for radiation therapy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions choline as a surrogate for tumor burden in dose painting but does not provide specific results on its efficacy or safety in this context.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of dose painting strategies in radiation oncology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of choline as a PET imaging agent for cancer diagnosis and monitoring, particularly in tumors with low FDG uptake or high background FDG uptake.
results_summary: Choline, as a PET imaging agent, was found to be more specific to tumor cells than FDG, aiding in differentiating cancers from benign conditions and diagnosing cancers with low or high background FDG uptake. It leverages increased membrane lipid synthesis in tumors for improved diagnostic accuracy.
population_specificity: Patients with tumors, particularly those with low FDG uptake or high background FDG uptake.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between depressive symptoms, hippocampal metabolites (including choline-containing compounds), and treatment response in depressed patients receiving electro-acupuncture combined with Fluoxetine or Fluoxetine alone.
results_summary: The study found that the Cho/Cr ratio showed a significant difference before and after treatment in the electro-acupuncture group, correlating positively with pre-treatment HAMD scores, while no such change was observed in the Fluoxetine-only group.
population_specificity: 75 cases of mild or moderate depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and diagnostic potential of 7T breast MRI, including the detection of choline concentrations in breast cancer patients undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study detected choline concentrations as low as 0.77 mMol/kg(water) and observed a decrease in choline levels (from 4.2 to 2.6 mMol/kg(water)) in one patient after NAC, correlating with tumor size reduction. All 7T MRI findings were consistent with pathology analysis.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients receiving neoadjuvant chemotherapy and healthy volunteers.

study_goal: The study aimed to summarize the 2010 EAU guidelines on treating advanced, relapsing, and castration-resistant prostate cancer, including the role of diagnostic tools like (11)C-choline PET/CT.
results_summary: The study noted that (11)C-choline PET/CT has limited importance if PSA levels are below 2.5 ng/ml, suggesting its diagnostic utility is context-dependent. No direct efficacy or safety outcomes for choline supplementation were discussed.
population_specificity: Men with advanced, relapsing, or castration-resistant prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the neurobiological events linked to Alzheimer's disease (AD) and potential treatment approaches, including the role of choline-related biochemical changes.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that decreased choline acetyltransferase levels are a consistent biochemical finding in AD, but it does not report specific results on choline supplementation or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of Alzheimer's disease pathology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic accuracy of combined 1H-MRSI-DCE-MRI versus [(18)F]choline PET/CT in detecting local prostate cancer recurrence in patients with biochemical progression after radical retropubic prostatectomy.
results_summary: Combined 1H-MRSI-DCE-MRI showed higher sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy than [(18)F]choline PET/CT in detecting local prostate cancer recurrence, particularly in patients with low biochemical progression (PSA 0.2-2 ng/mL). The MRI technique outperformed PET/CT in both small (Group A) and larger (Group B) lesion sizes.
population_specificity: 84 high-risk patients with biochemical progression after radical retropubic prostatectomy, divided into Group A (lesions 5.00-7.2 mm) and Group B (lesions 7.6-19.4 mm).

study_goal: To evaluate the usefulness of choline PET/CT for initial staging of prostate cancer and compare it with other imaging modalities.
results_summary: The study found that routine use of choline PET/CT for initial staging of prostate cancer is not yet recommended, but improved MRI methods (USPIO-MRI and diffusion-weighted MRI) show promise for accurate lymph node imaging.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical, biochemical, and genetic features of primary flavin mono-oxygenase 3 deficiency, a disorder of choline metabolism, and discuss therapeutic approaches to manage trimethylamine accumulation.
results_summary: The study highlights that the disorder leads to trimethylamine accumulation, causing a socially debilitating odor, and reviews dietary, pharmacological, and gastrointestinal manipulation strategies to reduce trimethylamine levels.
population_specificity: Individuals with primary flavin mono-oxygenase 3 deficiency (an inborn error of choline metabolism).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether choline levels, measured via MRSI, could predict tumor progression and treatment failure in glioma patients compared to other imaging techniques.
results_summary: The study found that maximum choline within tumor tissue and Cho/Cr ratios were significantly higher in progressive disease, suggesting choline's potential as a biomarker for tumor progression, though its prognostic value was not statistically significant in Cox analysis.
population_specificity: 37 patients with gliomas (21 women, 16 men; mean age 48 ± 14 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) influence dietary choline requirements and metabolic responses, particularly focusing on gender and genetic variations.
results_summary: The study found that most men and postmenopausal women develop liver or muscle dysfunction when deprived of dietary choline, while many premenopausal women are resistant due to estrogen-induced PEMT gene activity. Those premenopausal women requiring dietary choline had a SNP in PEMT, making them unresponsive to estrogen. Additionally, SNPs in MTHFD1 increased choline requirements due to its role as a methyl donor.
population_specificity: Men, postmenopausal women, and premenopausal women with specific genetic variations (SNPs in PEMT or MTHFD1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if choline-containing compounds measured via MRS could identify early demyelination in the centrum semiovale after CO exposure and predict chronic neurological symptoms.
results_summary: Higher Cho/Cr ratios in Groups P and D correlated with abnormal MBP levels, suggesting early demyelination, while no significant changes in NAA/Cr ratios were observed. The Cho/Cr ratio was predictive of chronic neurological symptoms post-CO intoxication.
population_specificity: 29 adult patients treated for CO exposure, categorized by symptom persistence, and 13 healthy volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the relationship between plasma free choline and related metabolites and leukocyte acetylcholine in children with cystic fibrosis (CF) compared to healthy children.
results_summary: The study found that children with CF had significantly lower plasma free choline and leukocyte acetylcholine levels compared to healthy controls. Leukocyte acetylcholine was positively correlated with plasma free choline in children with CF, suggesting a potential metabolic link.
population_specificity: 34 children with CF (pancreatic insufficient) and 16 healthy children.
